# Base url

https://icgauth.qpa.bpce.fr/dacsrest/api/v1u0

### for forge the Saml Request, please refer to the java code.

## Example response of SAML Request:

```
{
  "id": "CtxDACSLQ31c872d0223bd44d3b9c20a65f52fedf722",
  "locale": "en",
  "context": {
    "CTX_ONEY_BANKING": {
      "SENDER_NAME": "12869",
      "texte_sms": "Banque Oney Digitale\rValidation de lacces a votre application mobile\rCode :",
      "NOTIF_DESC": "Demande authentification",
      "SEND_NOTIF": "true",
      "NOTIF_TITLE": "Opération sensible",
      "DESC": "Demande d'ajout de bénéficiaire externe : MrXX"
    }
  },
  "step": {
    "phase": {
      "state": "AUTHENTICATION",
      "retryCounter": 3,
      "fallbackFactorAvailable": false,
      "securityLevel": "202"
    },
    "validationUnits": [
      {
        "45ea4718-fed0-4a98-9daa-82949e8869ad": [
          {
            "type": "SMS",
            "id": "c8fa7fce-0820-4855-8571-c3be11b41e6f",
            "maxSize": 8,
            "minSize": 8,
            "phoneNumber": "06XXXXXX17"
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }
}
```

you can build a VerifierObject with:

id starting with CtxDacs, would be verifierId

!! In metadatas, please persist the validationUnits. You will need it for validate the auth with ICG.

!! Then, make a mapping of the different type and correle this type with our. Don't hesitate to create new one if this is available.


#### For verify that an auth is valid.

You can reach the POST /transaction/:verifierId/step endpoint and put as body parameters:

````
{ 
   "validate": { 
        "ec73329d-d08a-42b2-8036-9feef12108e9": [ 
           { 
              "type":"SMS", 
              "id":"b7e0d25b-a739-46ed-b4c7-6fc83c69af4a", 
              "otp_sms":"67600744" 
           }
        ] 
    } 
}
````

the first id is the validationUnit id receive in response of saml request.
type: "SMS" | "CLOUDCARD" it can variate depending on what icg know about our user.

### Example of response of verify auth with ICG.

````
{
  "id": "CtxDACSLQ49eab37b4a56b4b4c8102cb2d98cef2ea22",
  "locale": "en",
  "context": {
    "CTX_ONEY_BANKING": {
      "SENDER_NAME": "12869",
      "texte_sms": "Banque Oney Digitale\rValidation de lacces a votre application mobile\rCode :",
      "NOTIF_DESC": "Deamnde authentification",
      "SEND_NOTIF": "true",
      "NOTIF_TITLE": "Opération sensible",
      "DESC": "Demande d'ajout de bénéficiaire externe : Mr BERLON Philippe"
    }
  },
  "response": {
    "status": "AUTHENTICATION_SUCCESS",
    "saml2_post": {
      "samlResponse": "",
      "action": "http://localhost:8080/resultat",
      "method": "POST"
    }
  }
}
````


### How To use ?

1. Make the saml request.
2. Persist the information in StrongAuthVerifier entity.
3. Verify the auth is valid by submiting validationUnits to the endpoint /transation/:verifierId/step
4. Handle the auth validation response.

Happy Coding and May the force be with you!
